verses.kjv: Then they told David, saying, Behold, the Philistines fight against Keilah, and they rob the threshingfloors.
verses.ct: Someone reported to David, "The Philistines are attacking Keilah and looting the threshing floors."

verses.kjv: Therefore David enquired of the LORD, saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And the LORD said unto David, Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.
verses.ct: So David asked the LORD, "Should I go and attack these Philistines?" The LORD told David, "Go, attack the Philistines, and rescue Keilah."

verses.kjv: And David’s men said unto him, Behold, we be afraid here in Judah: how much more then if we come to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?
verses.ct: But David's men said to him, "We're already afraid just being here in Judah. How much worse will it be if we march to Keilah to face the Philistine army?"

verses.kjv: Then David enquired of the LORD yet again. And the LORD answered him and said, Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into thine hand.
verses.ct: David asked the LORD once more, and the LORD answered him, "Get up and go down to Keilah, because I will give you victory over the Philistines."

verses.kjv: So David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and smote them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
verses.ct: So David and his men went to Keilah, fought the Philistines, captured their livestock, and defeated them with a devastating blow. David rescued the people of Keilah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand.
verses.ct: When Abiathar son of Ahimelech fled to David at Keilah, he brought an ephod with him.

verses.kjv: And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said, God hath delivered him into mine hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars.
verses.ct: Saul was informed that David had gone to Keilah. Saul said, "God has handed him over to me, because he's trapped himself by entering a town with gates and bars."

verses.kjv: And Saul called all the people together to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men.
verses.ct: Saul summoned all his forces for war, planning to march down to Keilah and surround David and his men.

verses.kjv: And David knew that Saul secretly practised mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, Bring hither the ephod.
verses.ct: David learned that Saul was secretly plotting against him, so he told Abiathar the priest, "Bring the ephod here."

verses.kjv: Then said David, O LORD God of Israel, thy servant hath certainly heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake.
verses.ct: Then David prayed, "LORD God of Israel, your servant has heard for certain that Saul plans to come to Keilah and destroy the city because of me."

verses.kjv: Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? will Saul come down, as thy servant hath heard? O LORD God of Israel, I beseech thee, tell thy servant. And the LORD said, He will come down.
verses.ct: "Will the leaders of Keilah hand me over to him? Will Saul actually come down, as your servant has heard? LORD God of Israel, I beg you, tell your servant." The LORD answered, "He will come down."

verses.kjv: Then said David, Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul? And the LORD said, They will deliver thee up.
verses.ct: David asked, "Will the leaders of Keilah hand me and my men over to Saul?" The LORD answered, "They will hand you over."

verses.kjv: Then David and his men, which were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he forbare to go forth.
verses.ct: So David and his men, about 600 of them, left Keilah and moved from place to place wherever they could. When Saul was told that David had escaped from Keilah, he called off the expedition.

verses.kjv: And David abode in the wilderness in strong holds, and remained in a mountain in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand.
verses.ct: David stayed in the wilderness in fortified positions and lived in the hill country of the wilderness of Ziph. Saul searched for him constantly, but God did not give Saul victory over him.

verses.kjv: And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life: and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in a wood.
verses.ct: David knew that Saul had come out to hunt him down. At that time, David was in the wilderness of Ziph, in a forested area.

verses.kjv: And Jonathan Saul’s son arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened his hand in God.
verses.ct: Saul's son Jonathan went to David in the forest and encouraged him to stay strong in God.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Fear not: for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth.
verses.ct: He told him, "Don't be afraid. My father Saul will never get his hands on you. You will become king over Israel, and I will serve as your second-in-command. Even my father Saul knows this is true."

verses.kjv: And they two made a covenant before the LORD: and David abode in the wood, and Jonathan went to his house.
verses.ct: The two of them made a covenant in the LORD's presence. Then David stayed in the forest, and Jonathan went home.

verses.kjv: Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself with us in strong holds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of Jeshimon?
verses.ct: The Ziphites went up to Saul at Gibeah and said, "David is hiding among us in the fortified positions in the forest, on the hill of Hachilah, south of Jeshimon."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, O king, come down according to all the desire of thy soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him into the king’s hand.
verses.ct: "So whenever you wish to come down, king, come ahead — and we will take responsibility for handing him over to you."

verses.kjv: And Saul said, Blessed be ye of the LORD; for ye have compassion on me.
verses.ct: Saul replied, "May the LORD bless you for showing concern for me."

verses.kjv: Go, I pray you, prepare yet, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who hath seen him there: for it is told me that he dealeth very subtilly.
verses.ct: "Please go and make further preparations. Find out exactly where he stays and who has spotted him there, because I've been told he is very cunning."

verses.kjv: See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking places where he hideth himself, and come ye again to me with the certainty, and I will go with you: and it shall come to pass, if he be in the land, that I will search him out throughout all the thousands of Judah.
verses.ct: "Scout out all the hiding places he uses, and come back to me with reliable information. Then I will go with you, and if he is anywhere in the region, I will track him down among all the clans of Judah."

verses.kjv: And they arose, and went to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the plain on the south of Jeshimon.
verses.ct: They left and headed to Ziph ahead of Saul. Meanwhile, David and his men had moved to the wilderness of Maon, in the open land south of Jeshimon.

verses.kjv: Saul also and his men went to seek him. And they told David: wherefore he came down into a rock, and abode in the wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon.
verses.ct: Saul and his men set out to search for David. When David was told about this, he moved down to a rocky area and stayed in the wilderness of Maon. When Saul heard this, he chased David into the wilderness of Maon.

verses.kjv: And Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and his men on that side of the mountain: and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about to take them.
verses.ct: Saul was moving along one side of the mountain while David and his men were on the other side. David was rushing to get away from Saul, because Saul and his forces were closing in on David and his men to capture them.

verses.kjv: But there came a messenger unto Saul, saying, Haste thee, and come; for the Philistines have invaded the land.
verses.ct: But just then a messenger came to Saul saying, "Come quickly! The Philistines have launched an invasion of the land!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against the Philistines: therefore they called that place Selahammahlekoth.
verses.ct: So Saul broke off his pursuit of David and went to confront the Philistines. That is why that place was named Sela Hammahlekoth.

verses.kjv: And David went up from thence, and dwelt in strong holds at Engedi.
verses.ct: David left there and settled in the fortified positions at En-gedi.
